Package frc.robot.subsubsytems

Class LimitedPIDSubsystem

java.lang.Object
frc.robot.subsubsytems.LimitedPIDSubsystem
public class LimitedPIDSubsystem extends Object
Represents a PID-controlled subsystem with limit switches and position control.

Example usage: 

 
 // Assume minSwitch and maxSwitch are created previously:
 LimitSwitch minSwitch = LimitSwitch.createDIO(0, 
         () -> System.out.println("Min limit triggered"), null);
 LimitSwitch maxSwitch = LimitSwitch.createDIO(1, 
         () -> System.out.println("Max limit triggered"), null);
 
 // Create the limited PID subsystem:
 LimitedPIDSubsystem subsystem = new LimitedPIDSubsystem(
         10,            // CAN ID
         1.0,           // conversionFactor
         0.0,           // minPosition
         100.0,         // maxPosition
         new PID(0.1, 0.0, 0.0), // PID constants
         minSwitch,     // min limit switch
         maxSwitch,     // max limit switch
         5.0,           // tolerance
         LimitedPIDSubsystem.ControlMode.POSITION);

  • Constructor Details

    • LimitedPIDSubsystem

      public LimitedPIDSubsystem(int canId, double conversionFactor, double minPosition, double maxPosition, Constants.PID pidConstants, LimitSwitch minLimitSwitch, LimitSwitch maxLimitSwitch, double tolerance, LimitedPIDSubsystem.ControlMode controlMode)
      Creates a new motor subsystem with position/velocity control and pre-created limit switches. This is the only supported constructor as it promotes cleaner code organization.
      Parameters:
      canId - The CAN ID of the motor controller
      conversionFactor - Factor to convert motor rotations to position/velocity units
      minPosition - Minimum allowed position value
      maxPosition - Maximum allowed position value
      pidConstants - PID constants for control
      minLimitSwitch - Pre-created limit switch for minimum position
      maxLimitSwitch - Pre-created limit switch for maximum position
      tolerance - Tolerance for position offset
      controlMode - Whether to use position or velocity control

    • LimitedPIDSubsystem

      public LimitedPIDSubsystem(int canId, double conversionFactor, double minPosition, double maxPosition, Constants.PID pidConstants, LimitSwitch minLimitSwitch, LimitSwitch maxLimitSwitch, double tolerance, LimitedPIDSubsystem.ControlMode controlMode, boolean isInverted)
      Creates a new motor subsystem with position/velocity control, pre-created limit switches, and motor inversion setting.
      Parameters:
      canId - The CAN ID of the motor controller
      conversionFactor - Factor to convert motor rotations to position/velocity units
      minPosition - Minimum allowed position value
      maxPosition - Maximum allowed position value
      pidConstants - PID constants for control
      minLimitSwitch - Pre-created limit switch for minimum position
      maxLimitSwitch - Pre-created limit switch for maximum position
      tolerance - Tolerance for position offset
      controlMode - Whether to use position or velocity control
      isInverted - Whether to invert the motor direction

    • LimitedPIDSubsystem

      public LimitedPIDSubsystem(int canId, double conversionFactor, double minPosition, double maxPosition, Constants.PID pidConstants, LimitSwitch minLimitSwitch, LimitSwitch maxLimitSwitch, double tolerance, LimitedPIDSubsystem.ControlMode controlMode, boolean isInverted, double zeroingPower)
      Creates a new motor subsystem with position/velocity control, pre-created limit switches, motor inversion setting, and custom zeroing power.
      Parameters:
      canId - The CAN ID of the motor controller
      conversionFactor - Factor to convert motor rotations to position/velocity units
      minPosition - Minimum allowed position value
      maxPosition - Maximum allowed position value
      pidConstants - PID constants for control
      minLimitSwitch - Pre-created limit switch for minimum position
      maxLimitSwitch - Pre-created limit switch for maximum position
      tolerance - Tolerance for position offset
      controlMode - Whether to use position or velocity control
      isInverted - Whether to invert the motor direction
      zeroingPower - Power to apply when zeroing the mechanism

  • Method Details

    • zeroIfNeeded

      public void zeroIfNeeded()
      Applies zeroing power if the subsystem's position is unknown.

      Example: 

       
 subsystem.zeroIfNeeded();

    • getState

      public LimitedPIDSubsystem.SubsystemState getState()
      Returns the current position knowledge state of the subsystem.

      Example: 

       
 SubsystemState state = subsystem.getState();

    • getPosition

      public double getPosition()
      Returns the current position of the mechanism.

      Example: 

       
 double pos = subsystem.getPosition();
      Returns:
      current position in mechanism units

    • set

      public void set(double value)
      Sets the target (position or velocity) of the mechanism.

      Example: 

       
 subsystem.set(50.0);
      Parameters:
      value - target value in mechanism units

    • getMotor

      public com.revrobotics.spark.SparkMax getMotor()
      Returns the underlying SparkMax motor controller.

      Example: 

       
 SparkMax motor = subsystem.getMotor();
      Returns:
      the motor controller

    • isAtMinLimit

      public boolean isAtMinLimit()
      Returns whether the minimum limit switch is currently triggered.
      Returns:
      true if at minimum limit, false otherwise

    • isAtMaxLimit

      public boolean isAtMaxLimit()
      Returns whether the maximum limit switch is currently triggered.
      Returns:
      true if at maximum limit, false otherwise
